newsitem.title: ITALY: PRESS DIGEST - ITALY - THURSDAY AUGUST 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - ITALY - THURSDAY AUGUST 7.

text.p: The following are some of the top headlines in leading Italian newspapers.

* Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi said in an interview that Italy would be ready and willing to take part in a speeded-up plan for Europe's single currency. Ciampi also said recent rises in the dollar did not worry Italy. (La Stampa)

* Former Nazi SS officer Erik Priebke, condemned last month for participating in Italy's worst World War Two massacre, has been denied house arrest and will be transferred to a military hospital. (all)

* The dollar has momentarily stopped its upward spiral. The strong dollar continues to put pressure on Italian petrol prices. Prices are likely to rise again after the August holiday if the U.S. currency does not come down. (all)

* At least one Italian soccer club is likely to launch on the London bourse next year but analysts question whether the likes of Juventus or Milan, which do not own their stadiums, can make the turnover of English Premier League clubs.
Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
